thread.title: Nazareth girls tennis doubles team's debut delivers district title
thread.title_full: Nazareth girls tennis doubles team's debut delivers district title

title: Nazareth girls tennis doubles team's debut delivers district title
text:
Nazareth sophomore Emma Haynes and freshman Jenn Soika never played doubles together. 
But on Saturday in their first match together, the District 11 Class AAA team championship came down to them. 
And the two young players made their doubles debut a special one as they helped deliver the first district title in program history for the Blue Eagles. 
Haynes and Soika rallied for a 3-6, 6-4, 6-1 win over Southern Lehigh 's Keelin McLoughlin and Kelly Asselin at second doubles to give the Blue Eagles the 3-2 win at Northwood Racquet Club in Palmer Township. 
"I know she's a good player so I knew we were going to be good together," Haynes said. 
"We just wanted to win so much," Soika said. 
Even facing a one-set deficit didn't deter the young Blue Eagles. 
"I had a determination where I wouldn't let myself lose opportunities," Haynes said of third set. "So I hit more consistent, served more consistently. We both just hit more consistent so that we could keep the ball in play." 
"Just keep the ball in play, we got it," Soika said about what the pair said after the first-set loss. 
Nazareth coach Barbara Van Buskirk liked how her two young players fit together as a team. 
"They both train year round," Van Buskirk said. "They're both hard hitters. We wanted that going into the match. And we just told them to stay focused, keep the ball in play and get their serves in. So that's what they did. Keeping it pretty simple."
